verses.text: And Samuel said unto all Israel , Behold, I have hearkened unto your voice in all that ye said unto me, and have made a king over you.
And now, behold, the king walketh before you: and I am old and grayheaded ; and, behold, my sons \add are\add* with you: and I have walked before you from my childhood unto this day.

Behold, here I \add am:\add* witness against me before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and before his anointed : whose ox have I taken ? or whose ass have I taken ? or whom have I defrauded ? whom have I oppressed ? or of whose hand have I received \add any\add* bribe to blind mine eyes therewith? and I will restore it you.\f + \fr 12.3 \ft bribe: Heb. ransom\f*\f + \fr 12.3 \ft to blind…: or, that I should hide mine eyes at him\f*
And they said , Thou hast not defrauded us, nor oppressed us, neither hast thou taken ought of any man’s hand.

And he said unto them, The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add is\add* witness against you, and his anointed \add is\add* witness this day , that ye have not found ought in my hand. And they answered , \add He is\add* witness. \p

¶ And Samuel said unto the people , \add It is\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* that advanced Moses and Aaron , and that brought your fathers up out of the land of Egypt.\f + \fr 12.6 \ft advanced: or, made\f*

Now therefore stand still , that I may reason with you before the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* of all the righteous acts of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, which he did to you and to your fathers.  +  r 12.7  t righteous…: Heb. righteousnesses, or, benefits *  +  r 12.7  t to: Heb. with *

When Jacob was come into Egypt , and your fathers cried unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, then the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* sent Moses and Aaron , which brought forth your fathers out of Egypt , and made them dwell in this place.

And when they forgat the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* their God , he sold them into the hand of Sisera , captain of the host of Hazor , and into the hand of the Philistines , and into the hand of the king of Moab , and they fought against them.

And they cried unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and said , We have sinned , because we have forsaken the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and have served Baalim and Ashtaroth : but now deliver us out of the hand of our enemies , and we will serve thee.
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* sent Jerubbaal , and Bedan , and Jephthah , and Samuel , and delivered you out of the hand of your enemies on every side , and ye dwelled safe.

And when ye saw that Nahash the king of the children of Ammon came against you, ye said unto me, Nay; but a king shall reign over us: when the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* your God \add was\add* your king.
Now therefore behold the king whom ye have chosen , \add and\add* whom ye have desired ! and, behold, the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath set a king over you.

If ye will fear the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and serve him, and obey his voice , and not rebel against the commandment of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, then shall both ye and also the king that reigneth over you continue following the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* your God :  +  r 12.14  t commandment: Heb. mouth *  +  r 12.14  t continue…: Heb. be after *

But if ye will not obey the voice of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, but rebel against the commandment of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, then shall the hand of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* be against you, as \add it was\add* against your fathers. \p
¶ Now therefore stand and see this great thing , which the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* will do before your eyes.

\add Is it\add* not wheat harvest to day ? I will call unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and he shall send thunder and rain ; that ye may perceive and see that your wickedness \add is\add* great , which ye have done in the sight of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, in asking you a king.

So Samuel called unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*; and the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* sent thunder and rain that day : and all the people greatly feared the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* and Samuel.

And all the people said unto Samuel , Pray for thy servants unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy God , that we die not: for we have added unto all our sins \add this\add* evil , to ask us a king. \p

¶ And Samuel said unto the people , Fear not: ye have done all this wickedness : yet turn not aside from following the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, but serve the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* with all your heart ;
And turn ye not aside : for \add then should ye go\add* after vain \add things\add*, which cannot profit nor deliver ; for they \add are\add* vain.

For the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* will not forsake his people for his great name’s sake: because it hath pleased the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* to make you his people.

Moreover as for me , God forbid that I should sin against the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* in ceasing to pray for you: but I will teach you the good and the right way :\f + \fr 12.23 \ft in: Heb. from\f*

Only fear the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and serve him in truth with all your heart : for consider how great \add things\add* he hath done for you.\f + \fr 12.24 \ft how…: or, what a great thing\f*
But if ye shall still do wickedly , ye shall be consumed , both ye and your king.
